Articles.Content: That is exactly what I said.
Will you make anything else for the an-225?

With mechjeb there is more than enough fuel in the proton to build a MIR.

It turns out yes, but only because the monoprop engines were so much more powerful than stock, which was a pleasant surprise. But by gawd do they wobble around enormously when trying to dock with Mechjeb!

Buran and Suttle its "not only military" ships. Multypurpose i mean.

Spiral only military space ship.

Can you make MAKS for use with AN-225 and civil versions of TKS and Salyut because CBBP's one is useless

And i really like N1 and i realized that your tutorial is somehow useful because when i seen Block A i used your way to get it more stable.

I think you can add struts to the payload.

Edited October 11, 2013 by Djolox

Can you make MAKS for use with AN-225

Maybe

TKS and Salyut because CBBP's one is useless

I dont make what make CBBP.
thank you bobcat for the reply :-) it might pop up one day. take care
what are you working on now beside the an-225? Or what else is planned?
Nothing planed for soon release
Its a MiG...imagine yourself a MiG-3 looking at you with big sad eyes...could you tell him that you wont add spiral?

Current version KSP no have useles wing configurator. No wing or control surface transform.

Now make good looking plane its madnes.

Now I have a lot of problems with An225, so even its release in question.

Edited October 11, 2013 by BobCat

Current version KSP no have useles wing configurator. No wing or control surface transform.

Now make good looking plane its madnes.

Now I have a lot of problems with An225, so even its release in question.

Did you test it with FAR? Or that wouldn't help?
no, no any others plugins. Im have experience male part for plugins... and now im have rule... no plugins here.
Do you have any tips about using the Buran arm? It likes to break....a lot...

Do you have any tips about using the Buran arm? It likes to break....a lot...

Do you have any struts on it? IIRC that was Romfarer's suggestion if it was breaking apart on you.

Current version KSP no have useles wing configurator. No wing or control surface transform.

Now make good looking plane its madnes.

Now I have a lot of problems with An225, so even its release in question.

That's too bad. Just think of the things you'll be able to do once this game gets closer to full release! You'll be a modding legend by then. Haha.

Maybe you could work on some new projects like the PPTS? I know it looks a lot like the Orion, but I love that Russian flavour!

EDIT:

Or Opsek would be nice...

Edited October 11, 2013 by kyle.mk.howard
Gotta add'em all!
I love that Website!
I think PPTS is much more like Dragon scince it will be able to touch down with engines. It's a very useful and nice concept tough.

I think PPTS is much more like Dragon scince it will be able to touch down with engines. It's a very useful and nice concept tough.

Good point! Either way, I would love to see someone tackle this!

Why don't you make the space station Russia has planned to build once the ISS's mission ends?

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orbital_Piloted_Assembly_and_Experiment_Complex

If you want some ideas Bobcat, here's a good one - Shenzhou!

AKA "Chinese Soyuz" I believe somewhere on the forum there is already a Long March rocket but there ain't no Shenzhou mod. What do you say?
Man, a MiG Spiral would be awesome! Also a Dyna-Soar is missing in KSP...if i had the time and talent to mod one of them. :-(

Question; I cannot for the life of me get the Kvant-1 to dock on the back of the Core Module. I've got the rest of the Mir together (bar the docking port) but the Kvant just will not stick. Is anyone else having this problem? Again, I'm using third party Craft files from the Spaceport, so it's possible it's been constructed incorrectly ... but any suggestions?
The docking port on the back of the Mir core might be put on backwards. It's easy to make that mistake, I did when building my first Mir. That led to some rage quitting...

The docking port on the back of the Mir core might be put on backwards. It's easy to make that mistake, I did when building my first Mir. That led to some rage quitting...

I've solved it now, I had to jettison the Probe core that was over the top of the docking port. But there's a new problem! I was about to send my first Kerbals to it via Soyuz TMA, and I only saw Bill and Bob. "Where's Jeb?" I wondered... he wasn't classed as lost, and the Mir didn't show any crew aboard... but it seems he's in the passenger seat of the Kvant-1? Eh?! And what's stranger is, I can't seem to get him out of there! Any ideas folks? If nothing else, I may have to design a Buran mission to move the Kvant via Robotic Arm into the cargo hold, and bring it down manually... or possibly attach a parachute to the rear and hope Jeb survives the descent back! Ahh ... adventures!
I would also like to Bobcat did PTK-NP
